name: Dragon Pose (Low Lunge - Yin Style)
setup: Back knee on mat, front foot flat on floor
Hands on floor or blocks for support
steps: Settle into lunge, allowing hips to sink forward
Keep front knee over ankle, not past toes
Back leg extends behind, knee on mat
Find your edge - moderate sensation, not pain
Hold still for 3-5 minutes (yin yoga timing)
Breathe slowly and deeply, relaxing into pose
Exit slowly: shift weight back, then switch sides
cues: Find your edge, then back off 10%
Stay still - this is passive stretching
Relax muscles, let gravity do the work
mistakes: Moving dynamically (this is a static hold)
safety: Use thick padding under back knee. Exit slowly after long holds. Stop if you feel joint pain or sharp pinching. This is a yin (passive) pose - never force.

regressions: Use blocks under hands for support
progressions: Add side bend away from back leg

prescriptionHints.notes: Yin yoga pose targeting hip flexors and quads. Hold still for extended time. Exit slowly.

joints.notes: Yin yoga works connective tissue, not muscle. Hold still and breathe. Exit slowly after long holds.
